item.title: [DISTRELEC-4412] Configure TypeKit for DE / EE / FI / LV / NL / PL
item.description:
Assignment including the new countries:

<!-- Typekit settings for common domains & local -->
<entry key="default" value="jjc2tiv" />
<entry key="local" value="jjc2tiv" />
<entry key="localhost" value="jjc2tiv" />
<entry key="netkauf.de" value="jjc2tiv" />
<entry key="sevenval-fit.com" value="jjc2tiv" />
<entry key="distrelec.com" value="jjc2tiv" />
	
<!-- Typekit settings for AT/CH/IT/DE -->
<entry key="distrelec.at" value="wzq0sic" />
<entry key="distrelec.ch" value="wzq0sic" />
<entry key="distrelec.de" value="wzq0sic" />
<entry key="distrelec.it" value="wzq0sic" />

<!-- Typekit settings for the Nordics -->
<entry key="incab.se" value="rkp4tdp" />
<entry key="distrelec.dk" value="rkp4tdp" />
<entry key="distrelec.ee" value="rkp4tdp" />
<entry key="distrelec.fi" value="rkp4tdp" />
<entry key="distrelec.lt" value="rkp4tdp" />
<entry key="distrelec.lv" value="rkp4tdp" />
<entry key="distrelec.nl" value="rkp4tdp" />
<entry key="distrelec.no" value="rkp4tdp" />
<entry key="distrelec.pl" value="rkp4tdp" />
<entry key="distrelec.se" value="rkp4tdp" />
item.summary: Configure TypeKit for DE / EE / FI / LV / NL / PL

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4404] LT Order History: Erroro 500 when opening order detail page
item.description:
Concerns LT / ElfaSAP integration:
When opening an order from the order history, an error 500 occurs.

E.g. when logged in with distrelec.testing+lt1@gmail.com / distrelec
on https://test.distrelec.lt/my-account/order-history

--------------------------------------

----------------------------
ID: 8
Response-Code: 200
Encoding: UTF-8
Content-Type: text/xml; charset=utf-8

18 Jun 2014 11:24:43 ERROR [hybrisHTTP28] [10.191.17.10] [error_page_log] a technical error occured [uuid: 01638466-fd86-49c7-bef5-c5061cfc18ab].
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.namics.distrelec.b2b.facades.order.converters.SapReadOrderResponseOrderHistoryConverter.populate(SapReadOrderResponseOrderHistoryConverter.java:136)
        at com.namics.distrelec.b2b.facades.order.converters.SapReadOrderResponseOrderHistoryConverter.populate(SapReadOrderResponseOrderHistoryConverter.java:1)
        at de.hybris.platform.commerceservices.converter.impl.AbstractConverter.convert(AbstractConverter.java:41)
        at de.hybris.platform.commerceservices.converter.impl.AbstractConverter.convert(AbstractConverter.java:35)
        at com.namics.distrelec.b2b.facades.order.impl.SapOrderHistoryFacade.getOrderForCode(SapOrderHistoryFacade.java:72)
        at com.namics.distrelec.erpabstraction.inout.erp.impl.RoutingOrderHistoryFacade.getOrderForCode(RoutingOrderHistoryFacade.java:27)
        at com.namics.distrelec.b2b.storefront.controllers.pages.AccountPageController.orderDetails(AccountPageController.java:1112)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
        at org.springframework.web.method.support.InvocableHandlerMethod.invoke(InvocableHandlerMethod.java:213)

        at org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.method.AbstractHandlerMethodAdapter.handle(AbstractHandlerMethodAdapter.java:80)

        at org.springframework.web.servlet.DispatcherServlet.doService(DispatcherServlet.java:827)

        at org.springframework.web.servlet.FrameworkServlet.doGet(FrameworkServlet.java:778)
item.summary: LT Order History: Erroro 500 when opening order detail page

comments.comment:
Hi Neeraj
could you please check the following code (line 136) in class SapReadOrderResponseOrderHistoryConverter (rev: 9049)?
Is it the right implementation?

if (distOrderData.getB2bCustomerData() != null) {
    distOrderData.setCustomerType(((DistCustomerData) distOrderData.getB2bCustomerData()).getCustomerType().getValue());
}

Hi Francesco,

I did comparison of code from revision:9046 till revision:8309 and found these line of code was present from the beginning of this file.
So there is no doubt on the implementation of this. However it looks like there are some problem with B2bCustomerData that is causing this problem.

Hi Francesco,

The problem has been fixed now. The root cause of the problem was due to Qualifier called "defaultDistCustomerConverter" which has been change in recent factoring in spring xml.

The right fix has been applied to the class and has been tested local, its working fine

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4366] Logrotate for httpd logs seems not to work correctly
item.description:
The log rotate seems not to work as expected. It seems that the log gets rotated but than the logs gets written to *_log.1 log. This file becomes than very huge (sometimes several GB).
Please check why it is not using the normal log file and is rotating properly.
item.summary: Logrotate for httpd logs seems not to work correctly

comments.comment:
The problem seems to be the Windows CR/LF.

Converted all files with dos2unix.
tested on qa systems: looks ok now!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4365] Zip wrapper log
item.description: The wrapper logs get never zipped. Please add a zip command to the hybris_cleanup script to zip the files older than 24h (-mtime +0)

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4289] Create the tests sites for PL / NL / EE / LV / FI
item.description: please start with the creation of the remaining ELFA countries: NL, PL, EE, LV, FI
item.summary: Create the tests sites for PL / NL / EE / LV / FI

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4174] Availability facet is not working correctly, because of a change in the FF export
item.description:
The instock value has chnaged from a boolean to the values 0,1,3. In that case the facet is not longer a boolean.
Change the facet to a multiselect facet, which displays the availability for the default/alternative warehouse like:

  • Available in 24h (200)
  • Available in 72h (68)
item.summary: Availability facet is not working correctly, because of a change in the FF export

comments.comment:
As discussed with Florian:

  • please remove the avilability facet for R2.0.
  • please analyze/fix after the LT rollout.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4091] FE Issues My Account User Management (Newsletter)
item.description:
In the MyAccount section, there are the follwoing front end issues with the newsletter subscription part of the login data management (see screenshot):

  • yes/no radio buttons: they should be on the same line, yes on the left, no on the right, instead of one upon the other (as per styleguide) (orange part)
  • subscription questions (yellow part): they should only appear if the user selected "yes" in the above radio boxes
  • distance between last option and the "change" button (blue part) is too small, should be at least the same as the distance between two checkbox options.
item.summary: FE Issues My Account User Management (Newsletter)

comments.comment: If the greyed out stuff is not a frontend-bug, consider checking this issue: DISTRELEC-4264

Still not quite ok:
1) now the user never has a chance to change his settings
2) the implementation does not comply with the styleguide. The dropdown is not styled and the distances are too small.

Expected behavior is:
Regarding 1)

  • state 1: not subscribed
    • "no" is selected
    • user clicks on "yes"
    • the form below immediately appears, so that the user can select an industry and a category before clicking on change
    • if user clicks on "no" again at this point, the form should disappear
  • state 2: user is subscribed, has not confirmed yet
    • "yes" is selected
    • form below is visible but greyed out
    • if user clicks on "no" again at this point, the form should disappear
  • state 3: user is subscribed and has confirmed his subscription
    • "yes" is selected
    • form below is visible and editable
    • if user clicks on "no" again at this point, the form should disappear

Regarding 2)

  • see screenshot of the standard newsletter subscription form. The form styles, distances etc should be the same.

Re-tested after Q deployment:

  • design wise it looks perfect now
  • but the issue 1) (last comment) still persists:
    • form does not immediately appear/disappear when yes/no is clicked
    • so the user can still not select a segmentation before clicking the "change" button

After reading up on the finer details of the Terrific functionality, I've changed the javascript slightly. Now it should work on all platforms.

Checked in account-login-data.skin.newsletter.js to SVN branch 2.0.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3722] FE: Detail page image gallery misplaced promo banners & icon
item.description:
Concerns detail page image gallery.

  • if there is no promo label for an article: all good
  • if there is one promo label for an article:
    • the distance of the "+" icon from the right border is too wide, should only be (about) 20px
  • if there are two promo labels for an article:
    • there is vertical distance between the two labels. there should be no distance
    • the "+" icon is too far away from right border, same as above; and it needs to move up a little with the promo label (should keep same vertical distance to lower promo label as now)
item.summary: FE: Detail page image gallery misplaced promo banners & icon

comments.comment: I suggest keeping a small (2px) distance between labels for improved visibility. OK?
Checked in updated CSS files to SVN branch 2.0.
